verses.roman:
kahite kahite prabhura mana phiri' gela
krodha-aṁśa śānta haila, utkaṇṭhā bāḍila

synonyms: kahite kahite—talking and talking; prabhura—of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; mana—mind; phiri' gela—became changed; krodha-aṁśa—the part of anger; śānta haila—became pacified; utkaṇṭhā—agitation of the mind; bāḍila—increased.
translation: While Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu was talking like this, His mind changed. His anger subsided, but His mental agitation increased.
